main event: A missile or rocket-like object was observed in St. Gallen, Switzerland, on August 15, 1963.
interesting points: The object had an intense white light and climbed rapidly, estimated at 15-18,000 ft.,It left a short orange tail and was intermittently visible due to terrain,The object was tracked for approximately 3.5 minutes and made zig-zag movements before vanishing,Several other reports of unidentified aerial phenomena were made in the same time frame and location,There was speculation in local newspapers about flying saucers related to the sighting.
sighted object: Missile or rocket-like object emitting intense white light
witness description: Object observed by local residents; no confirmed witnesses provided in report.
